thread.title: Forsyth DA announces attorney general campaign
thread.title_full: Forsyth DA announces attorney general campaign

title: Forsyth DA announces attorney general campaign
text:
Forsyth County District Attorney Jim O'Neill to run for NC attorney general Published 4:06 PM EDT Oct 12, 2015 Photos 
Jim O'Neill 
Forsyth County District Attorney Jim O'Neill formally announced his campaign for state Attorney General Monday afternoon. Related Gas prices remain steady; rise on way? 
O'Neill made the announcement at the Forsyth County Courthouse. 
O'Neill has been the county's district attorney since 2009, and he began working in the DA's office in 1997. 
O'Neill's announcement came a few hours before current state Attorney General Roy Cooper was scheduled to make a "special announcement" in Rocky Mount. Cooper, a Democrat, is widely speculated to be formally declaring his run for governor against GOP incumbent Pat McCrory. 
State Sen. Josh Stein, a former deputy to Cooper, announced his attorney general campaign last month.David Jeannot will have more details of O'Neill's announcement later Monday on WXII 12 News. Forsyth Co. D.A. Jim O'neill announces his candidacy for NC Attorney General. @WXII pic.twitter.com/96EUdY8uv4
